alert.note: Alert for Brazos; Burleson; Grimes; Washington (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 14 at 9:41PM CDT by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of western Grimes, eastern Burleson, southern Brazos and northeastern Washington Counties through 1015 PM CDT... At 940 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Snook, or 11 miles southwest of College Station, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... College Station, Bryan, Navasota, Snook, Millican, Kyle Field, Wellborn and Carlos. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for southeastern Texas. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch also remains in effect until 200 AM CDT for southeastern Texas.
